column4: hi, in ubuntu server 10.04, why can't i: sudo apt-get install mysql; stop mysql;
1) dbus isn't installed, why?
2) when I install dbus, I get the error about sending message, why?
but mostly, why can't I: sudo apt-get install mysql; stop mysql in an out of the box ubuntu 10.04 LTS server?
you can in 9.10
I've done all of those, and they also recommend the new "upstart" way, and pass to that
so I've done all those forms
all give the same error, all use dbus, dbus is not installed
it means don't use enter to end a sentence as it scrolls the channel to agressive
I know what it means, i am not doing that, I am saying things in a normal fashion, individual statements, you are just making noise by invalidly trying to state that I don't undestand this
you where doing that, it would be helpful if you could try not to, I do it myself so I know how easy it is

I also dislike it, although I think I wasn't doing it. I agree you can slip into it, I will refrain from doing it. I want to convery my question as efficiently as possible. My main thing is now, I've seen the "hack" to remove these errors (you must know of them, mysql is a highly used package) but where is the update?
update for what ?
update for not having dbus installed, and the update for the misconfigured upstart
I don't see those errors at all
fresh install, install ubuntu server 10.04, apt-get install mysql, then just stop mysql, that works for you?
by mysql you mean the package "mysql-server"
yes, apt-get install mysql-server
yes, I can do a service start/stop for it, no problem

I've been getting dodgy installs from this server co., they insist now that this is a 100% virgin 10.04, from ubuntu servers, ubuntu server edition... and I've read that other people get these errors, so are you completely sure?
I read that as mod 101, or 101% in some RPN form
